snippet: A new effort announced in Brooklyn will allow a carefully chosen group of women who plead guilty to felonies to remain in their own homes instead of serving their sentences in jail.
abstract: Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes announces JusticeHome, program that will allow carefully chosen group of women who have pleaded guilty to felonies to remain in their own homes with their children; intent is to establish alternatives for mothers convicted of crimes, who often see their children end up in foster care or in jail themselves; nonprofit Women's Prison Association will administer program.
lead_paragraph: A new effort announced in Brooklyn will allow a carefully chosen group of women who plead guilty to felonies to remain in their own homes instead of serving their sentences in jail.
